newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish actor in real-life Kafka "Trial".
newsitem.headline: Turkish actor in real-life Kafka "Trial".

text.p: A Turkish actor faces up to three years in jail for reciting a passage of Franz Kafka's novel "The Trial" in court to judges trying him for deliberately flouting freedom of expression laws, a newspaper said on Friday.

The Demokrasi newspaper said Mahir Gunsiray appeared in an Istanbul court on Thursday accused of "insulting the bench" for reading aloud a section of the Czech's novel in a State Security Court in May, the paper said.
The book details the nightmarish journey through a repressive legal system of an ordinary man who is never aware of the charges against him.
Gunsiray had originally been on trial with almost 100 other people who had published a banned book to draw attention to Turkey's harsh freedom of expression laws. That trial is continuing.

"The Turkish legal system has been turned into a comedy," Demokrasi quoted him as saying. The paper said Gunsiray also quoted Don Quixote's self-effacing companion Sancho Panza in his defence on Thursday. The case was adjourned until December.
Turkey's restrictions on written dissent, mostly used against Kurdish activists, have often been criticised in the West.
